text: hey guys this is the shirt and sweet
version of the Pad Thai episode for
those of you who just want to get the
gist of the recipe for the full version
you can click on the link right below
enjoy cup Kunta
if you want to start with some palm
sugar add some water and then microwave
it for about 30 seconds just to get most
of it dissolved stir in some tamarind
juice some fish sauce and that's pretty
much it for the sauce organize your
ingredients by combining together sweet
preserved radish shallots garlic dried
shrimp pressed tofu and as much chilli
flakes as you want in another bowl you
want to put together some bean sprouts
garlic chives and half of the crushed
peanuts in addition to these you also
need some shrimp dry rice noodles which
have been rehydrated in cold water our
pot pie sauce 2 eggs and we're ready to
go so we're going to first cook our
shrimp don't stir them so they Brown
nicely on both sides of course when
they're done just set them aside for now
in the same pan we're going to add our
bowl of tofu and all the other bits and
pieces cook them till the garlic starts
to turn golden brown and then add the
noodles stir them up a little bit and
then in goes the sauce keep tossing and
stirring until the noodles have absorbed
all the sauce then you want to make some
room and add the eggs break the yolks up
a little bit and just let them set a
little then smother the eggs with the
noodles and just let the egg set for
another 15 seconds or so check that the
eggs are sliding freely and flip break
up the eggs a bit and then add all your
veggies mix it up do one final flip and
it's done
let's plate so you want to get some
extra bean sprouts on the side some
garlic chives a slice of lime top it up
with your shrimp sprinkle some peanuts
and add some extra chili flakes and
finally time to eat and there you go
it's popped I in a nutshell for the full
version of this recipe you can click the
link on the screen or in the description
right below the written recipe is on hot
Thai Kitchen calm thanks for watching
and I will see you next time for your
next delicious Thai meal
